content.full_text: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Jackson A. Hough, 28 September 18571 Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance Company, Pay toJ. A. Hough.or BearerEight.50/100Dollars,IN CURRENT BANK NOTES.$8.50 Richards & Smith, Printers.2
paragraphs: Check of Abraham Lincoln to Jackson A. Hough, 28 September 18571 Springfield Marine & Fire Insurance Company, Pay toJ. A. Hough.or BearerEight.50/100Dollars,IN CURRENT BANK NOTES.$8.50 Richards & Smith, Printers.2
citations:
U.S. Census Office, Seventh Census of the United States (1850),  Springfield, Sangamon
                     County, IL, 123; U.S. Census Office, Eighth Census of the United States (1860),  Springfield,
                     Sangamon County, IL, 241.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote the handwritten portions of this check and signed his name.

2Although it is unclear what Lincoln purchased from Jackson A. Hough with these funds,
                  given that Hough was a carpenter and cabinet maker, it was likely a piece of furniture
                  of some sort.U.S. Census Office, Seventh Census of the United States (1850),  Springfield, Sangamon
                     County, IL, 123; U.S. Census Office, Eighth Census of the United States (1860),  Springfield,
                     Sangamon County, IL, 241.
